original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs132.4bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields were kept largely unchanged at this week’s auction with 132.4 billion out of 140 billon offered being sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 98.7 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.80 percent, down 02 basis points from a week earlier, after offering 80 billion rupees.
Only 16 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.42 percent unchanged from a week earlier after offering 30 billion rupees.
